summary:
Senior level manager with over 10 years of managerial experience. I have held various leadership roles in humanitarian sector with different INGOs and UN Institutions, where I have consistently delivered outstanding results. Strong strategic planning, people and change management skills. 

Experienced Operations/Logistics Manager proficient at monitoring operational pulse to deliver relevant information to all major internal customers and stakeholders. Accustomed to working with multiple entities to achieve organization goals for logistics efficiency, cost containment and contract integrity. Possesses strong leadership skills with clear decisive direction and decision-making skills and is experienced in the full range of supply chain and procurement functional areas including subcontracts, purchasing, expediting, material control, logistics and supplier inspection.

Bilingual English/French with experience managing talented logistics, Supply chain and procurement staff. Background in ICT, logistics, supply chain management, procurement and inventory control within humanitarian sphere. Clear knowledge of humanitarian and Donors regulations and requirements, and ensuring compliance with international humanitarian law and domestic legislation and regulations.

I’m seeking a new position with the opportunity for new challenges and professional development and advancement. I offer my services to humanitarian organizations: NGOs, UN agencies, Foundations, and donors.

projects.description: Kenya Welfare Foundation (KWF) partnered with Women and Health Alliance International (WAHA) and AMREF in Obstetric Fistula Prevention and Repair project with a goal to empower women and young girls who suffer from obstetric fistula, a condition that causes incontinence, in an effort to heal and bring peace to these ostracized women. The project was also aimed to provide maternal health educational outreach programs and transportation support to pregnant women in rural villages in Kenya where health facilities aren’t near in order to prevent fistula and other childbirth injuries and deaths. (Many thanks to Hon. Beth Mugo the then Minister for Public Health and Sanitation for her personal and Ministry assistance; and to Her Excellency the First Lady Mama Margaret Kenyatta for her 'Beyond Zero' campaign).
projects.title: Obstetric Fistula assistance project in Kenya

organizations.name: Kenya Welfare Foundation (KWF)
organizations.description: Founder Chairman and the CEO of Kenya Welfare Foundation (KWF): Incorporated and registered in Kenya in April 2007 under Article 10 of the Corporation Act. A private philanthropic organization, non-governmental and international dedicated to helping orphaned by HIV / AIDS, young and less privileged communities reach their full potential by tackling the root causes of poverty.

organizations.name: SOS ENFANTS EN DETRESSE (SOSEED)
organizations.description:
In Mars 2001, Co-founder of NGO — SOS ENFANTS EN DETRESSE (SOSEED) Paris / France “SOS Children in Distress” an international non-governmental organization to in the prevention and protection of children against abuse and neglect. Its mission is to:
-	Assist in the prevention and protection of children from all forms of abuse, to make sure that the rights of children are respected, based on the International Convention on Children's Rights;
-	Provide different supports to children in distress, victims of abuse, mistreatment or neglect, and families at risk. 

Both Kenya Welfare Foundation (KWF) and SOS Enfants En Detresse (SOSEED) participated, co-sponsored and co-organized the second International Society of Obstetric Fistula Surgeons (ISOFS), a conference on surgery and obstetric fistula which was held in Nairobi, Kenya, on the 25-27 of November 2009.

organizations.name: Kenya Overseas Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KOCCI)
organizations.description: Founder and CEO of the Kenya Overseas Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KOCCI), Private bilateral non-profit organization, formed in February / 2011 in Paris, whose mission is to promote trade, commerce, tourism, Branding Kenya - investment and cultural, and brainchild of Nairobi Solid Waste Management (NSWM) and the Energy-from-Waste (EfW) project proposal to Nairobi and Mombasa County Government.

Dear Kenyans and friends of Kenya - Happy Madaraka Day, 2024

Today marks a monumental milestone in our beloved Country, Kenya’s journey – the celebration of Madaraka Day! This day, June 1st, holds a special place in our hearts and in our history. It was on this day back in 1963 that Kenya achieved internal self-rule. 

The term ‘Madaraka’ – translating to ‘Authority’ or ‘Self-Governance’ in Swahili – perfectly encapsulates the essence of this day. It’s the day we took the reins, charting our own course towards a brighter future.

As we commemorate the 61st Anniversary of this pivotal event, let’s take a moment to honour and appreciate the immense sacrifices and relentless efforts made by our selfless compatriots in the struggle for self-governance.

Their dedication and resilience continue to inspire us today.
Join us in celebrating this historic day. 

Happy Madaraka Day! 
Kenya, Our Strength, Our Country, Our Home! 
#MadarakaDay #MadarakaDay2024 #ProudlyKenyan #SNKinuthia #Duke_of_Githunguri #PatriotWamother

Isn't it fascinating to see how easily this bird perches on the hand of its human companion, as if the hand were a tree branch? It's amazing to hear the variety of sounds it can produce! We can only wonder if it's a pet or not. Regardless, the bond between human and bird is remarkable. Let's remember that every being on this planet deserves to enjoy their journey. Let's strive to make our planet a home for all, human or non-human.

These two CEOs Michelle Nunn  of CARE  and CEO of The Carter Center  Center Paige Alexander  are undoubtedly one of the greatest minds in the current humanitarian sphere.
In my unsolicited views, when great minds meet to address, discuss vision and strategic strengthening of democracy, it will help setting strategies to counter anti-democratic attitudes and reduce partisan animosity experienced in many countries today. The Carter Center and Care partnership could also help tapping humanitarian skills, and leveraging investment expertise for humanitarian goals.
I personally thank TCC and CEO Ms Paige for role played in signing the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the US Centre for Disease Control (CDC)the Kenya Medical Research Institute (KEMRI)  the Ministry of Health and the US President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief in developing a sustainability Roadmap for Kenya's HIV Programme.

The MOU will also see the dissemination and application of research findings for policy formulation, training of public health professionals, strengthening research leadership and laboratory capabilities, staff exchanges, and sharing of research information and materials in accordance with Kenyan laws, as well as any other mutually beneficial health-related research activities.
Big thanks to The Carter Center  and Emory University

Join us for the next Fresh Perspectives with Michelle Nunn and CEO of The Carter Center Paige Alexander. 
 
Paige will share her vision and strategies for strengthening democracy, highlight the "Inform Women, Transform Lives" initiative, and reflect on President Jimmy Carter's legacy and the Center's commitment to positive change.

Friendship is a beautiful bond that connects us with others in a way that's pure and true ❤️. It's a relationship that's built on trust, understanding, and mutual support, and it comes from a place of love and kindness in our hearts 💖. When we have true friends, we feel seen, heard, and valued, and we know that we can count on them through thick and thin 🤝.

True friends are the family we choose for ourselves, and they bring so much joy and richness to our lives 🌈. They're the ones who laugh with us, cry with us, and lift us up when we're down 🤗. They're the ones who know us best and love us anyway, and who help us become the best version of ourselves 🌟. And even when we're apart, our hearts remain connected, and we know that we're always there for each other 💕.

So, let's cherish our friendships and nurture them with love, care, and attention 🌱. Let's be there for our friends, listen to them, and support them in all they do 🤝. And let's never forget that friendship is always from the heart, and that it's one of the greatest gifts we can give and receive in life 💖. Remember, true friends are a treasure, and they deserve all the love and appreciation in the world! 🌈

Grand merci Artus!

Le cinéaste Artus et les acteurs en situation de handicap de son film à succès "Un p’tit truc en plus" monteront les marches du Festival de Cannes le 22 mai… avec un gros truc en moins.

Ce samedi 11 mai, Artus a révélé qu’aucune marque de luxe ne leur avait prêté de tenue de soirée.
Selon lui, pas une seule n’a accepté d’habiller l’équipe pour cette montée des marches. "Je ne comprends pas pourquoi. On nous sort des histoires de quotas, en disant 'On a déjà prêté tous nos costumes'", a-t-il déploré.

Il a assuré ne pas croire à cette explication : "Je pense que c’est toujours plus élégant pour une marque d’habiller Brad Pitt que d’habiller Artus et encore plus des acteurs en situation de handicap."

Il a finalement déclaré, doucement amer : "C’est pas grave, c’est nos costumières du film qui vont leur faire des très beaux costumes et ça va être très bien !" 👔👗

Le film fait un carton avec presque 2 millions d'entrées au cinéma, mais aucune marque de luxe n'accepte d'habiller l'équipe du film...

Il n'y a plus qu'à partager massivement pour faire bouger les lignes ! LVMH

Suivez-moi 👉 Benjamin Louis / Coeur Handisport

Bernard Pivot pivote les mots et est amoureux de la langue française - Je le quiff!

title.text: Hommage à Bernard « un pivot de la langue française »

message.text:
«Vieillir, c’est chiant »
Hommage à Bernard « un pivot de la langue française »
 ————————————————//
Il y’a des mots qui meurent et des mots qui restent éternels.

Les mots éternels sont ceux qui sont partagés parce que vivants, dynamiques et constructifs. Ce sont des mots qui accrochent, comme le premier regard d’un amoureux !

Des mots qui font effet à l’esprit, des mots qui réveillent les sens.
Des mots qui secouent l’imagination des hommes de lettres pour donner forme à leur créativité.
 
Bernard Pivot fait partie de ces vrais HOMMES DE LETTRES ! Chaque mot de ce texte « Vieillir, c’est chiant » extrait de son livre « Les mots de ma vie », est d’une intensité incroyable !!
 
Bernard Pivot, journaliste, écrivain, littéraire, animateur et producteur d’émissions culturelles est « un as des mots ». Il a donné à la langue française ses plus belles lettres de noblesse de par ses critiques littéraires. Aujourd’hui rappelé à l’Eternel, son œuvre restera néanmoins inoubliable – parce que rien que son nom (Pivot) rappelle l’essentiel de la vie. Dans le dictionnaire français le mot Pivot est synonyme du mot - âme - centre - clef de voûte - soutien - etc.
 
Reposez en paix cher Bernard Pivot - Vous êtes « un pivot de la langue française »

One love
 
____// PlumeCitoyenne - MaremKANTE - Mardi 07 mai 2024

The relationship between climate change and violent conflict...
There is no direct and linear relationship between climate change and violent conflict, but under certain circumstances climate-related change can influence factors that lead to or exacerbate conflict. Reduced access to water and extreme weather events may e g negatively affect food security and undermine the livelihoods of vulnerable households and communities. Growing natural resource scarcity may then lead to local competition which becomes unmanageable in the absence of institutions for conflict resolution. Fragile states and communities with a history of conflict are the most vulnerable. Migration that is influenced by climate-related events is predominantly domestic, not international. There is no evidence of interstate conflicts where climate change is a direct or indirect cause. But climate-related effects will grow in magnitude with consequences in space and time that are difficult to predict. To reduce the risk of conflict, policies and strategies need to consider the importance of good governance, interaction between sectors and policy areas, as well as unintended negative effects of climate adaptation or emission reductions, including those that influence land, water and forest tenure. @sida.se

Tomorrow, May 8, our President and CEO, Nancy Aossey, will be at the Milken Global Conference talking about preparedness and response strategies to support the growing number of people displaced by climate change and regional conflicts. #MIGlobal
